titleStmt.title: H. A. McCaleb et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12050

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 81, Folder 75th Regiment 1862-1865 Nominations and Commissions

body.p:
Maysville Ky May 8th 1865
To his honor
Thos. E. Bramlette Gov of Ky

The undersigned citizens of Maysville and Mason Co Ky would recommend for your Consideration the appointment of Lieut' Rueben S. Darnall for the purpose of raising the number of men requisite to fill the Quota for Mason Co. Lieut Darnall has been in the U. S. Service for three (3) Years and we think Competant to take charge of same

Respectfully Obdt Servants
H. A. McCaleb Col 121st
Wm. R. Gerhart Maj. 191st
O. A. DeLewis A. Adj. 121st
J. S. Cady. Capt U. S. Police
F. A. Jennings Lt & Pro Marshal
Jno Shackleford M. D.
C C Cady Major
James A Lee Jr.
Jno M Duke Jr.
H. Taylor
W. H. Savage
Robt A Cochran
R. G. January
C. B. Anderson
R D Anderson S,

W H McGranagahan
We the above named, officers of the 121st cordially endorse the foregoing recommendation and believe Lieut Darnell worthy and well qualified for the position

H A McCaleb
Col
M Jac Ross
Thos J. Throop
George Wormald U S Police
J.. C. Brookover
J. M. Rains
W, P, Watkens
G W Tudor
Wm Wormald
R. Albert.
George Cox
Lissaul Cox
S. T. Miner
Thos X Manner, Late Maj 40" Ky Vols
W H Wise
J. L. Pearce

Mason
Maysville, Ky
May 8th 1865
Taylor Harrison and others
Recommends that Lieut Reuben S. Darnell be appointed for the purpose of raising the no of men to fill the quota of Mason Co Ky-
Respectfully referred to W. H. Hays Inspector General of Kentucky

D. W. Lindsey
Insp Gen Ky
Cox
Ans. May 20, 65. Let. B'k B. p. 229
Rec. In. Gen Off. May 20, 1865
